intro: Heteranthera oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water hyssop, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist environments such as wetlands and marshes. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically important species in aquatic habitats.
